qas.question: How much of Michigan's population resides in the Detroit metropolitan area?
How big is the population of the Detroit-Windsor area?
How many square miles is is Detroit's urban area?
In which census are these numbers coming from?

context: Detroit is the center of a three-county urban area (population 3,734,090, area of <a2_0>1,337 square miles<a2_0/> (3,460 km2), a <a3_0>2010<a3_0/> United States Census) six-county metropolitan statistical area (2010 Census population of 4,296,250, area of 3,913 square miles [10,130 km2]), and a nine-county Combined Statistical Area (2010 Census population of 5,218,852, area of 5,814 square miles [15,060 km2]). The Detroit–Windsor area, a commercial link straddling the Canada–U.S. border, has a total population of about <a1_0>5,700,000<a1_0/>. The Detroit metropolitan region holds roughly <a0_0>one-half<a0_0/> of Michigan's population.
